intro: Anacampseros conferta, commonly known as the clustered stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically gray-green in color, covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its drought tolerance, it is well-suited for xeriscaping and low-maintenance gardens.
